item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "And no practical definition of freedom would be complete without the freedom to take the consequences. Indeed, it is the freedom upon which all the others are based." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you have enough book space, I don't want to talk to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's still magic even if you know how it's done." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fantasy is an exercise bicycle for the mind. It might not take you anywhere, but it tones up the muscles that can. Of course, I could be wrong." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Chaos is found in greatest abundance wherever order is being sought. It always defeats order, because it is better organized." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Sometimes glass glitters more than diamonds because it has more to prove." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There are times in life when people must know when not to let go. Balloons are designed to teach small children this." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "There isn't a way things should be. There's just what happens, and what we do." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Many people could say things in a cutting way, Nanny knew. But Granny Weatherwax could <i>listen</i> in a cutting way. She could make something sound stupid just by hearing it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Evil begins when you begin to treat people as things." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "All tapes left in a car for more than about a fortnight metamorphose into Best of Queen albums." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Only in our dreams are we free. The rest of the time we need wages." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "She walked quickly through the darkness with the frank stride of someone who was at least certain that the forest, on this damp and windy night, contained strange and terrible things and she was it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A marriage is always made up of two people who are prepared to swear that only the other one snores." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The sun rose slowly, as if it wasn't sure it was worth all the effort." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It was lonely on the hill, and cold. And all you could do was keep going. You could scream, cry, and stamp your feet, but apart from making you feel warmer, it wouldn’t do any good. You could say it was unfair, and that was true, but the universe didn’t care because it didn’t know what “fair” meant. That was the big problem about being a witch. It was up to you. It was always up to you." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Whut's the plan, Rob?" said one of them. "Okay, lads, this is what we'll do. As soon as we see somethin', we'll attack it. Right?" This caused a cheer. "Ach, 'tis a good plan," said Daft Wullie." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Rincewind could scream for mercy in nineteen languages, and just scream in another forty-four." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The merest accident of microgeography had meant that the first man to hear the voice of Om, and who gave Om his view of humans, was a shepherd and not a goatherd. They have quite different ways of looking at the world, and the whole of history might have been different. For sheep are stupid, and have to be driven. But goats are intelligent, and need to be led." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fear is a strange soil. It grows obedience like corn, which grow in straight lines to make weeding easier. But sometimes it grows the potatoes of defiance, which flourish underground." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It's going to look pretty good, then, isn't it," said War testily, "the One Horseman and Three Pedestrians of the Apocalypse." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Just because it's not nice doesn't mean it's not miraculous." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Books must be treated with respect, we feel that in our bones, because words have power. Bring enough words together they can bend space and time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Bishops move diagonally. That's why they often turn up where the kings don't expect them to be." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Karen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "This time it had been magic. And it didn't stop being magic just because you found out how it was done." -- Terry Pratchett
